construct_name: Contextual Learning Environment Agent Master Construct
core_principle: Assess the learner's ecological context across all EST levels (Micro through Chrono) to identify barriers, enablers, and readiness signals that modulate the pedagogical path.

hard_gates: EPR readiness gate must pass for deployment
global_governance.escalation_policy: Blocked EST level → escalate to CLEA supervisor or human review
global_governance.iteration_policy: Re-assess EST levels when context changes (session start, environment shift)

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Ecological Systems Theory (1979, 1994) + Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development, Digital Divide Theory, Social Presence Theory

measurement_principles.immediacy: Focus on current, directly experienced environment
measurement_principles.bidirectionality: Consider both learner impact on and from environment
measurement_principles.proximal_processes: Assess quality of regular, progressive interactions

decision_rules.barrier_threshold: Any microsystem factor below 40/100 triggers barrier flag

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Ecological Systems Theory (1979, 1994) + Boundary-Crossing Theory (Akkerman & Bakker), Home-School Partnership Research, Identity Continuity Theory
what_to_measure: Expectation coherence between home and school

measurement_principles.consistency: Agreement in expectations and values across contexts

decision_rules.leverage_points: Strong connections can compensate for weak ones

validation_criteria: All microsystem pairs assessed for connection quality

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Ecological Systems Theory (1979, 1994) + Institutional Theory (DiMaggio & Powell), Digital Infrastructure Studies, Educational Governance Research

measurement_principles.indirect_influence: Assess structures learner doesn't directly participate in
measurement_principles.stability: Consider reliability and predictability of support systems

decision_rules.enablement_threshold: Exosystem enablement below 40/100 is critical barrier

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Ecological Systems Theory (1979, 1994) + Cultural Capital Theory (Bourdieu), Critical Pedagogy (Freire), Intersectionality Theory (Crenshaw)
what_to_measure: Cultural valuation of education and learning

measurement_principles.cultural_sensitivity: Respect diverse cultural values and practices
measurement_principles.epistemic_justice: Ensure diverse knowledge forms are valued

decision_rules.alignment_threshold: Macrosystem misalignment below 50/100 requires cultural bridging
decision_rules.cultural_strengths: High cultural valuation is leverageable asset

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Ecological Systems Theory (1979, 1994) + Life Course Theory (Elder), Transition Theory (Schlossberg), Cumulative Disadvantage Theory

measurement_principles.temporal_sensitivity: Consider timing and sequencing of events
measurement_principles.cumulative_effects: Track accumulation of disruptions over time
measurement_principles.recovery_capacity: Assess ability to recover from transitions

decision_rules.stability_threshold: Chronosystem stability below 40/100 triggers protective measures
decision_rules.transition_load_max: More than 2 concurrent major transitions is high risk
decision_rules.recovery_minimum: Learner needs minimum recovery window before new challenges

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Bioecological Model (2006) + Barrier Analysis Methods (WHO ICF), Cumulative Risk Theory, Protective Factor Framework
what_to_measure: Barrier inventory across all EST levels

measurement_principles.holistic_view: Consider barriers across all ecological levels simultaneously
measurement_principles.interaction_effects: Identify how barriers compound and cascade
measurement_principles.actionability: Prioritize barriers that can be addressed

decision_rules.cascade_detection: If barrier_A triggers barrier_B, address A first

validation_criteria: All EST levels represented in barrier inventory

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Bioecological Model (2006) + Universal Design for Learning (CAST), Strengths-Based Approach, Culturally Responsive Pedagogy (Gay)

measurement_principles.equity_orientation: Address structural barriers, not just symptoms
measurement_principles.feasibility: Strategies must be actionable within constraints

strategy_selection.barrier_structural: Flag for equity adjustment or escalation

decision_rules.personality_integration: Adjust strategies based on learner preferences

validation_criteria: All priority barriers have strategy assigned

sections.theoretical_basis: Bronfenbrenner's Bioecological Model (2006) + Context-Aware Computing, Adaptive Learning Systems Theory, Interoperability Standards (IEEE LOM)

measurement_principles.completeness: All EST levels represented in handoff
measurement_principles.actionability: Downstream agents can act on provided context
measurement_principles.integration: Personality and ecological context are coherent

validation_criteria: All downstream agents have required context

sections.theoretical_basis: Ecological Participation Registry (EPR) + Bronfenbrenner's Ecological Systems Theory, Digital Divide Theory, Universal Design for Learning
what_to_measure: Human context factors (21 atoms across EST levels)
